main event: Multiple unidentified aerial objects, described as bright, shiny silver, disc-shaped, and oblong, were sighted in different locations in Ohio in 1949. The objects were observed traveling at fast speeds, wobbling, climbing, descending, and in some instances appeared to be completely immobile in the air before disappearing behind obstacles.
interesting points: The objects were observed over several days by multiple residents of Sidney, Ohio and Hardin, Ohio, indicating sustained and repeated sightings.
Witness descriptions included the objects being disc-shaped, five inches in diameter, and oblong in shape, with some leaving a gray-colored trail behind.
The objects were reported to be completely immobile in the air, despite their high speeds, and made no sound or emitted any odor.
Sightings were investigated by the Air Material Command, Wright-Patterson Air Force Base, Dayton, Ohio, indicating the military's interest in these reports.
Despite the observations, no photographs were taken of the objects, and no conclusive explanation was provided.
witnesses: multiple residents of Sidney, Ohio and Hardin, Ohio
photographs: no photographs included in the report
